alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:34PM EST until December 21 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Augusta. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water reaches the back of some buildings on Water Street in Augusta. Widespread impacts occur near the waterfront to several businesses in downtown Augusta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:06 PM EST Monday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 23.1 feet late tomorrow morning. This will exceed the flood in May 2023 which crested around 20 feet. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
